did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: Brotherhood of Carpenters and Joiners Documents on Microfilm, 1881-1979

origination.label: Creator:
origination.corpname: United Brotherhood of Carpenters and Joiners of America (UBC)

did.repository: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Microfilm copies of Brotherhood of Carpenters and Joiners Circular Letters, February 20, 1903 - June 22, 1971

bioghist.head: ORGANIZATIONAL HISTORY
bioghist.p: The United Brotherhood of Carpenters and Joiners of America, better known as the United Brotherhood of Carpenters (UBC).

It was founded in 1881 by Peter J. McGuire and Gustav Luebkert. UBC is one of the largest trade unions in the United States and with its chapters and locals there is an international cooperation that gives it a global role.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions:
accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use:
userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.

prefercite.p: Brotherhood of Carpenters and Joiners Documents on Microfilm #5718 mf. Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library.
